ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Presbycusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral symmetrical sensorineural hearing loss with gradual onset over 15 years in an older adult, consistent with cochlear aging.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bell's palsy (Right VII nerve pathology)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Sudden onset right facial drooping following a cold, with acoustic reflex patterns showing absence when the probe is in the right ear (efferent pathway deficit).

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess hearing thresholds given complaint of hearing loss.
Evaluate speech discrimination ability, particularly in noise.
Evaluate the reflex arc to localize pathology, specifically checking facial nerve function.
Rule out retrocochlear VIII nerve pathology.
Assess cochlear outer hair cell function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results show a bilateral mild sloping to moderately-severe sensorineural hearing loss consistent with presbycusis. Tympanometry is normal. Acoustic reflexes are absent whenever the probe is placed in the right ear (Right Ipsi, Left Contra), indicating a right facial nerve (efferent) pathology consistent with Bell's palsy. ABR, OAE, and Tone Decay results are consistent with cochlear hearing loss and rule out VIII nerve retrocochlear lesions.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical SNHL, mild in low frequencies sloping to moderately-severe in highs (250-500Hz ~10-15 dB, 4000Hz ~55 dB).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 15 dB HL bilaterally; SRS 88% (Right) and 84% (Left).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A bilaterally (Static compliance 0.50 cc R, 0.54 cc L).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent when probe is in the Right ear (Right Ipsi, Left Contra); Present when probe is in the Left ear (Left Ipsi 95 dB, Right Contra 90 dB).

tests.name: ABR
tests.result_summary: All waves prolonged; interpeak latencies normal; latency-intensity function steep (cochlear pattern).

tests.name: Tone decay test
tests.result_summary: Minimal decay (10 dB Right, 15 dB Left in 60 seconds), consistent with cochlear pathology.

proposed_items: Discuss hearing aids without overstressing their value given patient's lack of interest
counseling_actions: Explain that hearing loss is likely due to aging (presbycusis)
Explain that facial paralysis is likely Bell's palsy and unrelated to the hearing loss
Reassure patient regarding the facial palsy, noting the trend toward improvement
Advise seeing an otolaryngologist for the facial palsy

escalation.rationale_short: To evaluate the right facial nerve paralysis (Bell's palsy), although likely improving.

follow_up_plan.timeline: One year, or sooner if changes are noticed
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds and status of facial palsy.
